alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:44AM EDT until May 02 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Carroll, Cumberland and Oxford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Faster flows along the river are expected but no flooding occurs. Interests near the river should continue to monitor later forecasts. High risks for recreational paddlers. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding as Moat Brook backs up and floods Transvale Road, cutting off access to a dozen homes and camps. Beaches at area camps flooded. At 8.0 feet, Flooding begins along the east bank campgrounds in Conway and North Conway. Campers along the river should move to higher ground. At 9.0 feet, Expect flooding of low-bottom fields and private roads in Conway and North Conway. Minor flooding in Transvale Acres, Moat Brook Bridge, and the lower part of E. Road flood. At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters surround properties across Transvale Acres. Flood waters 1 to 2 feet deep in sections of east bank camping areas. At 11.0 feet, Flood waters 2 to 3 feet deep at east bank camping areas. At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters reach West Side Road. Much of Transvale Acres floods from Moat Brook Bridge east to the Saco River. Numerous structures become flooded with buildings on campgrounds flooded by several feet. Campers should move to higher grounds. At 13.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs on West Side Road in two sections, cutting off access to hundreds of homes. River Road flooded on the west bank impacting agricultural lands. Floodwaters inundate first floors of properties in Transvale Acres. This is a dangerous situation at riverside campgrounds. At 14.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs along the west bank of the Saco River near Moat Brook Road, cutting off access to some homes. Flood waters enter agricultural lands in eastern Conway and into Freyburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EDT Monday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 13.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 8.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise to 8.4 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall to 8.0 feet early Thursday morning. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
